Rice: This crop requires moderate to well distributed rainfall within its recommended range and grows best under suitable temperature conditions mentioned for the season. Ideal weather includes adequate sunlight, proper soil moisture, and good drainage. Farmers commonly use balanced NPK fertilizers along with micronutrients when needed. Pesticides such as chlorpyrifos, imidacloprid, or neem based formulations are used for controlling insects, while fungicides like mancozeb or carbendazim help prevent diseases. Integrated pest management practices are preferred. Timely irrigation, weed control, crop rotation, and soil testing improve yield and reduce risk. Weather extremes should be avoided.
